Build Parameters

Use the Build Parameters dialog box to specify the various settings and values for the build job.

After you have filled out the fields on this dialog box, click Next to go to the Submission dialog box.

Field Descriptions

Serena ChangeMan Builder project A read-only field displaying the name of the Serena ChangeMan Builder project.
Search path A read-only field displaying the name of the search path.
Job name A read-only field displaying the name of the build job.
Build machine Choose from the available build machines. The build machines displayed are those that were added to the build machine list box in the Job Selection Dialog Box. Changing the build machine changes the parameters, because each build machine has its own saved settings.
Build directory You can enter the name of a local build directory, or browse for it. If the build job has been executed before, this field contains the previous build directory. If the build job has not been executed before, it contains the default values of C:\Serena_Builder for Windows or $HOME\Serena_Builder for UNIX. If you are performing a remote build, the directory must be entered as it would be from the remote build machine. If the remote machine is mapped to a local drive, you can use the browse button to locate the remote build directory, but you may have to edit the resulting path. You can also use a predefined environment variable; for example, %SERENA_BUILDER_DIR%.
Bldmake parameters Accept the existing bldmake parameters, which are from the specified build job, or edit the parameters as desired.
OM parameters Accept the existing OM parameters, which are from the specified build job, or edit the parameters as desired.
Compile flags: Debug Click to select the debug compiler flags. The default value is the value specified in the build job.
Compile flags: Release Click to select the release compiler flags. The default value is the value specified in the build job.
Build mode Select Incremental, Exact, Clean, New, or Rebuild. Incremental retrieves newer workfiles from the archives. This is the default. Exact retrieves workfiles whose date and time do not exactly match the archives. Clean deletes all existing workfiles before retrieving archives. New requires that the build directory not currently exist. Rebuild rebuilds all intermediate and final targets.
Enable footprinting Click to cause a list of dependencies, including environment variable settings, to be embedded inside the final executable. You can later view this information with the OMIDENT utility in the /bin folder of the build directory. OMIDENT filename > footprint.txt will write the footprinting information to a file named footprint.txt.
Enable project processing By default this option is selected; click to disable Version Manager project processing. When disabled, the following behavior ensues: 1) Target file revisions are retrieved but source file revisions are not; 2) Build mode is disabled, so Serena ChangeMan Builder uses only the files already in the build directory; 3) the Footprinting option is disabled.

See Also
